question: This is it.
Let's get that first barrel.

Last winter, a man kidnapped a little girl and holed up in one of these caves. The cops had him pinned down and began to move in. This guy started shooting... but he wasn't aiming at the officers... ...he was firing at something inside. When the dust cleared, all they found was the little girl's shoes. With the feet still in 'em.
Hey, relax, I nearly shit myself when my boss pulled that one on me. What was that?
Shhhh...
answer: Stop it right there! You will not rape Mother Nature one more day!

question: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Take it easy! We have a permit!
answer: And we have an injunction from the State to prevent any dumping in these caverns! This is virgin land! The aqueducts in these caves bring drinking water to our families, and its piping provides drainage for our farms that enrich this barren land! And it won't be tainted by waste of any kind! Not now! Not ever!

question: Fine, just back off! Let's roll... Now-now-now! How do you guys always know where we're going?
answer: I'll tell ya next time! NOW MOVE IT! Score one for the green team!!! We saved you today, ol' gal. Sister, why do you always swing for the fences? Give me the keys!!!

question: I mean, we'd been together for so long and then... bang! She drops me. Since then, it's been like a damn country song
JC Penny. Spring wear.
answer: You know, Chach, catching you at this low point is pure serendipity.

question: Why is that?
answer: Because I take the rubble of man and build superstars. In my briefcase here is a doorway to a self-help sensation. Give me a minute, because I'd like to buy you a drink and change your life forever. I have a brochure --

question: That's all she wrote... What?!
answer: Ohhh, now that's a rough one.

question: That's motherfuckin' impossible!
answer: Yoh anga will be yoh downfah. Go again?

question: Goddamn it! NO!
Unless you people want to die you'll do what I say and you'll do it fast!
answer: You hold it right there, mister.

question: A storm of hell's coming down on this place any minute!
I'm not armed now, just hear me out.
answer: I'll drop you and not even think about it!

question: Let me explain!

Take a good look and listen to me! There's at least a four of these things out there! I saw one of them tear up five men like they were corn on the cob! I don't know what they are. I don't know where they came from. All I do know is that these fuckers are fast, nasty, and hungry. And they can fly. Not to mention they got claws like Ginsu knifes and more teeth than a chainsaw. They're like goddamn blood hungry biker tattoos come to life. They're clocking us. Right now. And we have to lock this bar down! That means doors, windows, drains, and basements. We have to do it fast! You! Get on that phone. Call the cops, National Guard, townies, whoever kicks ass and get 'em out here. Any questions?
Is it clear?!
Is there a gun pointing at you?
Alright goddamn it! Who shot me!? Who did it!? My goddamn foot is gone! Who fuckin' shot me? Who fuckin' shot me!?
Jesus Christ on the cross... someone make sense.
answer: Easy. We're surrounded by something the likes none of you have ever seen before. Some kind of animals. Real fast, volatile, predators. One went through three of your patrons like nothing.

question: So, your dead hubby shot me twice, three of my customers have been eaten, and there are angry creatures outside?
Huh?
answer: He shot you the other time.

question: That's not it. Four are here, but there's three others... which I can't account for. We need to lock this place down. Is everyone in this room?
answer: Oh my god! My son! My SON!

question: Wait!
Thank you, but I don't need any help --
answer: What's this? A power magnet or something?

question: No. It's nothing.
answer: I didn't peg you for a con man.

question: Hey, it pays more than the couch.
answer: Lots of stuff around here does.

question: I have a signal! I have -- Diane? Diane listen to me... get the kids and get in the basement... do it right now... I'll explain later. Not now! I'm at a bar... look... shut up! JUST SHUT UP AND GET IN THE FUCKING BASEMENT, DIANE! Diane! Diane?... Hello? Damn it! I lost the signal! Okay. Okay. Look now, I gotta get outta here! I gotta go! My wife... See my wife is alone... She could be in trouble. I GOTTA GO!
Fuck you, bitch!
answer: You can risk your life, but not mine! My daughter's no more than twenty miles from here waiting for me. I have just as much reason to leave this place as you do. But I also know that if they're here, then they're not there yet. You understand me?

question: Get the fuck off...
Yes!
answer: Now pull that tough boy shit again and I'll slice you from neck to nuts!

question: You can't keep me here. This is bullshit. Fuckin' bullshit. This is fucking BULLSHIT!
answer: We can't risk letting them in.

question: And now, we head to our man on the scene with a live look at tomorrow's event in Red Mountain.
Can you hear us? Apparently we're having some technical difficulties...

We barricaded ourselves in the cellar. Then it was just listening. We heard those things destroy an entire heard of livestock. They just kept coming. Closer and closer, consuming anything in the way. Slashing, feeding and licking the bones clean. Just when we said our prayers, the first ray of sun hit the house... That first beam of sunlight drove 'em away. Somewhere. We called who we could and then decided to run for it. We didn't see a soul the whole drive out. When the tank went dry, we came upon a gas station to refill.
answer: What's goin' on? The pumps are off.

question: They've been here!
We had no time. All we knew was the sun was dropping and we had to get enough fuel to make it through the night at 90 miles per hour...
answer: Suck it down you metal bitch. Suck it down.

question: It happened fast...
answer: Move it! Get in the car, baby.

question: That's when I saw three others... just for a second.
Close the roof!
And that's how I ended up here.
I don't want to talk about that.
No. It was wild out there. No time to think. We just moved. He didn't leave me. He just ran.
You!
You gotta know somethin', you're old.
Old people know stuff like this. Legends, tall tales, shit like that.
Spill it!
You're a clever man. Why do you take shit from him?
answer: Yeah, he's an ass, but he's my brother. Que sera-sera.

question: Your brother, huh?
Same parents?
answer: Look man, I read books. He reads bumper stickers.

question: You're gonna need a whole lot more than that to get outta here alive.
answer: Oh, now you have something to say?

question: You young'uns worry about weapons, I'm thinkin' 'bout strategy.
Sit still, look less like a meal.
answer: That's for bears and sharks, chunky chew.

question: What are you gonna do? Throw your teeth at 'em? Sit down, Cocoon. You! Zorba! You're coming too! Now gimme the keys.
What?
answer: Those two will be on the other side waiting for you. If you become food, I don't want the only set of keys in the belly of one of those things.

question: Don't get your hopes up.
answer: Any volunteers to head into the basement with me?

question: Just keep 'em handy, ladies.
answer: Bozo hustles in. The door shuts and locks.

question: Wish me luck... I'm okay! I'm okay!
answer: Bozo rises and nervously surveys the damaged floor.

question: How are you holding up?
What is this?
answer: Morphine. My magic potion. I need a few drops. You should try a little, it'll calm your nerves. Works like a charm.

question: No other time than now, right?
answer: Wait, before you do that, help me move. There's a small room off the kitchen where I can lay down.

question: But --
answer: It's much safer in there. Trust me.

question: Doesn't your foot hurt?
answer: I can't feel a thing, Hon.

question: How 'bout now?
answer: You're a bad girl, aren't you.

question: Um-hmmm.
answer: The girl's got rhythm. There it is.

question: Let's get everything upstairs. I'm sorry.
I admire your strength.
answer: Trust me, I plan on having a full breakdown when this is over, but for now, we all have to be strong, right?

question: This is my daughter, Charlie. She's all I'm after.
And I'm gonna need your strength, every bit of it.
Good. But still do me a favor.
Don't tell anyone I have a soft side.
You wanna see, baby?
How much you got?
How much you got to see the show?
answer: You don't understand, sweety. Daddy doesn't pay. Daddy sees the show for free. But you do get points for being horny on a night like this.

question: What?
answer: You can't expect a man to buy a car without a test drive first, can you?

question: Um, hmm --
answer: Now wiggle that sweet little ass over here and sit on Daddy's face, I wanna do some appraising.

question: What?
You know what.
You. What was that door downstairs?
What's it for? What's it for!?
answer: Grass, man. I grow pot down there.

question: Does the tunnel spit out near a car?
answer: It spits out behind the parking lot. My truck is near, but it ain't nearly big enough to haul the whole lot.

question: It's a shot. Is it gassed up?
Four door?
How many can it hold?
Max?
It's gonna fit thirteen.
How does it feel?
You still have one left.
It serves you right for cheating.
I figure it's karma. You wronged me and you wronged your wife, so this is karma biting you on the ass, or in your case... in the eye.
It could be worse, you could be dead. Then again, the climax is upon us.
answer: Ya know, that's not a bad look on you. Kinda 1985, but not bad. I'd hook it up.

question: I wouldn't fuck you for practice.
You handle yourself pretty well. You a cop or a criminal?
Oh yeah? Then how do you do it?
answer: I just think about my husband and daughter... and the rest is easy. Easy.

question: Ah-ah-ah! You're doing that all wrong!
I know you're doing it wrong.
Let's prepare ourselves, they ought to be here with the truck any minute.
answer: Bullshit. If you ask me, I'm gonna just lay right here, wait for sunrise, then walk on out of here.

question: That's your choice, but this is going to get a whole lot worse before it gets any better.
answer: If all of you run for it, they won't care about lil ol' me. They like the food that moves... OHHH!!!

question: Commence Plan B!
Just watch the floor and keep the others safe! Bomb's away!!!
One down, one to go!!!
This place is a ghost town.
Charlie? Charlie!
